definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Since then, China out of the monarchy into the period of democratic revolution.
sentences.chinese: 自此之後，中國脫離了帝制而轉入了民主革命時期。

sentences.english: Celebrated as the 99th anniversary of the Xinhai Revolution and the Wuchang Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 興祝辛亥革命成功結束了中國的帝制99週年紀念。

sentences.english: This was the fundamental reason why the doctrine of Confucius and Mencius had become the ruling thoughts of autocratic monarchy in Imperial China.
sentences.chinese: 這是孔孟之道成爲中華帝制統治思想的根本原因。

sentences.english: The king's subjects protested against his imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 國王的臣民反對他的帝制。

sentences.english: The Principate system, more than 500 years has laid a solid foundation for the imperial system.
sentences.chinese: 元首制度的建立，奠定了500餘年帝制的堅實基礎。

sentences.english: Accordingly, Roman Republic fell into the turbulence and was finally replaced by the autocratic monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬共和國陷入動盪，共和政體最終爲帝制取代。

definition: to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
